title: Court puts reinstatement of cannabis commission head on hold
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Massachusetts court temporarily halted Shannon O'Brien's reinstatement as Cannabis Control Commission chair after the state filed an appeal.
Judge Robert Gordon ruled O'Brien's dismissal was unwarranted and ordered her reinstatement with back pay, pending appeal.
State Treasurer Deborah Goldberg accused O'Brien of gross misconduct, prompting a legal battle involving over $970,000 in legal fees.

title: Man charged with murder after woman, 38, found dead in Lynn, DA says
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: A 38-year-old woman was found dead at a Newhall Street address in Lynn early Sunday morning.
A 30-year-old Lynn man has been arrested and charged with murder regarding the woman's death.
The suspect is scheduled for arraignment on Monday morning in Lynn District Court, names not released.

title: Jakobi Meyers shuts down questions about trade request: ‘Happy to be a Raider’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers remains happy with the Raiders despite requesting a trade due to contract negotiations.
Meyers caught eight passes for 97 yards in the Raiders' 20-13 win against the Patriots.
The Raiders, with new coach Pete Carroll, started 2025 on a positive note after a rough 2024 season.

title: Tornado confirmed in Mass. town as powerful storm sweeps over region
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A radar-confirmed tornado touched down in Holden, Massachusetts, during Saturday's storm, causing some damage.
The National Weather Service will survey the tornado's impact in Holden on Monday, assessing path and severity.
Severe thunderstorms affected the East Coast, particularly impacting areas around Worcester, Paxton, and Holyoke in Massachusetts.

title: In a season promising change, the 2025 Patriots looked all too familiar in season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots lost their season opener to the Las Vegas Raiders 20-13, highlighting familiar struggles.
Quarterback Drake Maye showed potential in the first half but faltered with interceptions and execution issues in the second.
Free-agent Harold Landry recorded 2.5 sacks, providing some promise to a defense that allowed big plays throughout the game.

title: Will Campbell’s NFL debut was solid until things began to unravel late in the second half
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Will Campbell's NFL debut saw him perform well initially before facing difficulties late in the game.
Campbell was involved in allowing two sacks and committed two false start penalties in the second half.
Coach Mike Vrabel emphasized the need for overall team improvement following the Patriots' 20-13 loss to the Raiders.

title: Lynn police officer on leave after becoming ‘suddenly incapacitated’ while on duty
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: A Lynn police officer was placed on administrative leave after appearing incapacitated during a traffic stop, sparking investigation.
Video shows the officer unresponsive and having difficulty standing, with speculation of drug or alcohol influence refuted by police.
Lynn Police Department cites a possible medical episode as the cause, while the investigation continues with medical consultations.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Harold Landry III excelled with 2.5 sacks in Patriots' 20-13 loss to Raiders under coach Mike Vrabel.
Kayshon Boutte led Patriots with most catches, targets, and receiving yards in home opener against Raiders.
Patriots' running backs struggled, totaling 60 yards; TreVeyon Henderson was the only back with over 15 yards.

title: Review & setlist: Dropkick Murphys come on strong, avert disaster at soggy Suffolk Downs
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: Dropkick Murphys performed despite a severe rain delay at the Seisiún festival in Suffolk Downs on September 6, 2025.
The concert resumed after a two-hour storm delay with festivalgoers initially evacuated and communication challenges through social media.
Dropkick Murphys' set included songs like 'The Boys Are Back' and a tribute to Shane McGowan, closing with 'I’m Shipping Up To Boston.'

title: Bill Belichick explains ‘simple’ reason why he decided to ban Patriots scout at UNC
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick banned a Patriots scout from UNC practices, citing mutual unwelcomeness between facilities.
Belichick's decision highlights ongoing tensions with the Patriots following his departure after the 2023 season.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel acknowledged UNC's ban decision, focusing instead on alternative scouting methods.
